I’m glad DOJ did not find any constitutional flaws on my #Statehood bill, #HR1522. We will continue working to enact the will of the people of #PuertoRico.
DOJ states that during the transition period to admission, Congress could decide to terminate the Oversight Board or provide an orderly transition into an entity of the new State of #PuertoRico.
The DOJ report also concludes that PROMESA “would not violate the uniformity requirement of the Bankruptcy Clause at all were Puerto Rico to become a state.”

The report confirms what we have been arguing. There is no other non-territorial status but statehood or independence. We do not need a status convention to tell us this and there is no other option that a status convention can propose.

DOJ’s report on #PuertoRico’s political status confirms that within the U.S. Constitution only two options are available: to become a state or remain as a territory. The other alternative outside of U.S. sovereignty is independence.
